data.title: Southwest Airlines Reported $68 Mil Q4 Net Income, Down $-378 Mil (-85%) QoQ, Driven By Cost Change
data.meta_description: . Southwest Airlines (LUV) Q/Q Net Income decreased by $0 Mil (-85%) to $68 Mil in 2021Q4 from $446 Mil in 2021Q3. Breaking Down Q/Q Net Income Change. Revenue increased by $372 Mil (8.0%) Q/Q and increased by $3,038 Mil (151%) Y/Y. Total Costs & Operating Expenses increased by $919 Mil (23%) Q/Q and increased by $1,688 Mil (51%) Y/Y. Non-Operating Income / (Expense) increased by $24 Mil (-89%) Q/Q and increased by $58 Mil (-95%) Y/Y. Tax Expense decreased by $-145 Mil (-94%) Q/Q and increased by $9 Mil (9223372036854775807%) Y/Y. Breaking Down Total Costs & Operating Expense Change. What Next? More from Trefis. Southwest Airlines Insights. Invest in Market-Beating Trefis Portfolios.
